Does this also resolve bug 1845628?'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-09-27 14:14:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 28: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

Why do we need the interface change on the driver destroy and cleanup methods? They aren't used.

The live migration shared storage check seems redundant (and potentially wrong).

There is 0 test coverage of the logic changes in the libvirt driver. For having rebased and pushed this change for so long without even having *unit* test coverage on it is pretty bad. It's already bad enough that we (nova) hacked this feature in without any integration testing, still don't have integration testing, and are now left with shoring up all of the various functionality gaps, e.g. stop/start/reboot/migrate uefi instances."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-09-27 14:17:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28706, 'date': '2021-06-11 07:08:18.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Boxiang Zhu.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-03 17:22:02.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Preserve UEFI NVRAM variable store

WIP before finishing tests. Please no review yet.

Closes-Bug: #1785123
Change-Id: I505beacb0da11aa2b8738c6fb4e90daf34aa940f
Signed-off-by: Jack Ding <jack.ding@windriver.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-12-04 16:05:56.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Preserve UEFI NVRAM variable store

WIP before finishing tests. Please no review yet.

Set NVRAM file for UEFI variable store to the instance folder
CONF.instances_path/<UUID> instead of the default folder
/var/lib/libvirt/qemu/nvram/.

Preserve NVRAM variable store during stop/start, hard reboot, cold
migration, resize and live migration. The NVRAM storage file is copied
over to destination host during cold and live migrations.

Closes-Bug: #1785123
Change-Id: I505beacb0da11aa2b8738c6fb4e90daf34aa940f
Signed-off-by: Jack Ding <jack.ding@windriver.com>

'}, {'created': '2019-01-29 19:52:06.000000000', 'message': 'Preserve UEFI NVRAM variable store

Preserve NVRAM variable store during stop/start, hard reboot, cold
migration, resize and live migration.

For UEFI guests (hw_firmware_type=uefi), every time the instance is
started, the UEFI variable storage for that instance
(/var/lib/libvirt/qemu/nvram/instance-xxxxxxxx_VARS.fd) is deleted
and reinitialized from the default template.

This commit sets the location of UEFI NVRAM file to the instance folder
CONF.instances_path/<UUID> instead of the default folder
/var/lib/libvirt/qemu/nvram/ to avoid the overwrite. During cold and
live migrations, the UEFI NVRAM file is copied over to destination host.

Closes-Bug: #1785123
Closes-Bug: #1633447
Change-Id: I505beacb0da11aa2b8738c6fb4e90daf34aa940f
Signed-off-by: Jack Ding <jack.ding@windriver.com>

commit_message:
Preserve UEFI NVRAM variable store

Preserve NVRAM variable store during stop/start, hard reboot, cold
migration, resize and live migration.

For UEFI guests (hw_firmware_type=uefi), every time the instance is
started, the UEFI variable storage for that instance
(/var/lib/libvirt/qemu/nvram/instance-xxxxxxxx_VARS.fd) is deleted
and reinitialized from the default template.

This commit sets the location of UEFI NVRAM file to the instance folder
CONF.instances_path/<UUID> instead of the default folder
/var/lib/libvirt/qemu/nvram/ to avoid the overwrite. During cold and
live migrations, the UEFI NVRAM file is copied over to destination host.

Closes-Bug: #1785123
Closes-Bug: #1633447
Change-Id: I505beacb0da11aa2b8738c6fb4e90daf34aa940f
Signed-off-by: Jack Ding <jack.ding@windriver.com>

commit_message:
[Train-Only] Parametrize ovs version to install in UC via leapp upgrade.

A new openvswitch version has been released, 2.15. As during the Undercloud
leapp upgrade we tell leapp which version of ovs to install in order to
save some extra restart, we now need to update the version to install.

However, the very same upstream branch is being used for two downstream
releases 16.1 and 16.2, and the openvswitch package version used on each
of them is different. For some reason, we need to parametrize it so that
we can specify which version to use for each CI job.

This patch adds a new parameter leapp_ovs_version which will determine
the openvswitch version to install while upgrading via leapp. By default,
it will use 2.13, which is the one used in 16.1.

Change-Id: I8647b36c0edc87e559dad748ced5c5acdeb91472
Related: rhbz#1966476

commit_message:
Allow ovn_db_host to be of type array

On an OVN clustered database environment, there is no OVN VIP as all
OVN databases are active. Neutron has to be configured to point to all
OVN database servers in the cluster.

Closes-Bug: #1931133

Conflicts:
	manifests/profile/base/neutron/agents/ovn.pp
	manifests/profile/base/neutron/ovn_metadata.pp
	manifests/profile/base/neutron/plugins/ml2/ovn.pp

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Change-Id: Ib8624f0c2e87de18a990060c3cb939c13ec3a6f2
(cherry picked from commit 0b51d8258c4a0618ec6f2abd8f86bfe6943cd51f)

I've worked on this a while ago but no longer working on it since this feature wasn't required for an ongoing project in the end.

One of the feedback I got offline was that this patch could be simpler by getting NFS info through charm config instead of a relation.

Feel free to take it over if somebody is interested in."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-11 05:01:25.000000000', 'message': 'Support NFS with the file driver

NFS can be used for redundancy for the file driver in addition to Ceph
or S3 options already available in the charm. Add "nfs" interface
support so the charm can receive information of NFS storage through the
relation.

Closes-Bug: 1931672
Change-Id: I328be51bc02c6ef8b234b18c57c13fdd759938e7
'}]
commit_message:
Support NFS with the file driver

NFS can be used for redundancy for the file driver in addition to Ceph
or S3 options already available in the charm. Add "nfs" interface
support so the charm can receive information of NFS storage through the
relation.

Closes-Bug: 1931672
Change-Id: I328be51bc02c6ef8b234b18c57c13fdd759938e7

(4 comments)

I dunno about other reviewers, but I definitely think this needs to be new permissions and not "maybe old or maybe new."

Is the lite spec up for the glance client change? I was thinking about this more last night, related to my comment about confusion over hitting the public endpoint for these. If I run the following set of commands:

* glance cache-list
* glance cache-image foo
* glance cache-list
* glance cache-delete-image foo
* glance cache-list

I could get one list, then a *different* list, and then an error trying to delete foo, followed by a list that shows foo, which I should be able to delete.

If the glance client doesn't *require* an override URL, then the above situation would be easy to accidentally execute. Once I have done that, I've cached foo on some unknown worker, and I have to hit each worker independently in order to figure out which one foo landed on, potentially clean that up, and then cache it on the right one.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-06-02 13:59:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(3 comments)

> Patch Set 6:
> 
> (4 comments)
> 
> I dunno about other reviewers, but I definitely think this needs to be new permissions and not "maybe old or maybe new."

Sounds good!!

> 
> Is the lite spec up for the glance client change?

Nope, I haven't started writing it yet, will try to put something together this week.

> I was thinking about this more last night, related to my comment about confusion over hitting the public endpoint for these. If I run the following set of commands:
> 
> * glance cache-list
> * glance cache-image foo
> * glance cache-list
> * glance cache-delete-image foo
> * glance cache-list
> 
> I could get one list, then a *different* list, and then an error trying to delete foo, followed by a list that shows foo, which I should be able to delete.
> 
> If the glance client doesn't *require* an override URL, then the above situation would be easy to accidentally execute. Once I have done that, I've cached foo on some unknown worker, and I have to hit each worker independently in order to figure out which one foo landed on, potentially clean that up, and then cache it on the right one.

Yes you are right about this, I think glance client will require override to direct the call to dedicated glance worker.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-06-02 14:22:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-06-02 14:28:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-07 12:39:04.000000000', 'message': 'Add missing default policy files for ubuntu-binary-horizon

The ubuntu-binary-horizon image is missing the default policies files
which should be in /etc/openstack-dashboard/default_policies. By copying
everything from /usr/share/openstack-dashboard/openstack_dashboard/conf
into /etc/openstack-dashboard, we get the default policy files, as well
as commented out policy files (e.g. cinder_policy.yaml) and the
nova_policy.d directory containing api-extensions.yaml.

Change-Id: I3c6fdcb9b7dd7443a7755599f7e4ee59f67e0a91
Closes-Bug: #1930586
(cherry picked from commit 740448a658f0060b86d56e78915d8b751ade3616)
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing default policy files for ubuntu-binary-horizon

The ubuntu-binary-horizon image is missing the default policies files
which should be in /etc/openstack-dashboard/default_policies. By copying
everything from /usr/share/openstack-dashboard/openstack_dashboard/conf
into /etc/openstack-dashboard, we get the default policy files, as well
as commented out policy files (e.g. cinder_policy.yaml) and the
nova_policy.d directory containing api-extensions.yaml.

Change-Id: I3c6fdcb9b7dd7443a7755599f7e4ee59f67e0a91
Closes-Bug: #1930586
(cherry picked from commit 740448a658f0060b86d56e78915d8b751ade3616)

Hi, I believe `python3-boto3` package has to be installed to make the S3 driver functional. It should be here or in an equivalent part:
https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-glance/src/commit/169c43690ed7622bebea3f0a6575ffbc53ef8f87/hooks/glance_utils.py#L102-L110

Also, as the S3 driver was absent for some time in the upstream, it would be nice to clarify that S3 can be used with Ussuri or later releases.
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/glance-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/glance_store/re-support-s3-driver.html'}, {'account_id': 28899, 'date': '2021-04-01 18:09:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

Hi all,

My two cents here: I was able to get the glance-api service up and running by installing boto3 (not python3-boto3, as mentioned above - there's no such package on PyPI) package, which was indeed missing:

 root@juju-194b65-1-lxd-1:~# /usr/bin/python3 /usr/bin/glance-api --config-file=/etc/glance/glance-api.conf
ERROR: No module named 'boto3'
root@juju-194b65-1-lxd-1:~# pip3 install boto3
Collecting boto3
<...>

Two more things worth our attention:

1) Currently, there is a bug in this code which prevents the s3 store to become the default one:

 root@juju-194b65-1-lxd-1:~# grep -A 5 's3:s3' /etc/glance/glance-api.conf
enabled_backends = local:file, ceph:rbd, s3:s3


 [glance_store]

 default_backend = ceph


2) The endpoint (s3-store-host) should be specified with the HTTP schema (either http or https), otherwise the image creation fails with:

 2021-04-01 17:54:45.038 873693 ERROR glance.common.wsgi ValueError: Invalid endpoint: radosgw.orangebox84.ru

After I've added the https:// prefix - everything went fine afterwards."}, {'account_id': 33192, 'date': '2021-04-12 13:25:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 28899, 'date': '2021-04-19 10:08:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

commit_message:
Allow enabling S3 object storage backend

S3 backend has been available (again) since Ussuri in the upstream
Glance. We will enable the backend with config options for an external
S3 storage information.

Co-authored-by: Connor Chamberlain <connor.chamberlain@canonical.com>
Co-authored-by: Vladimir Grevtsev <vladimir.grevtsev@canonical.com>
func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/574
Closes-Bug: #1919338
Change-Id: Id76a74cc6041b9c3364399254681138475f19935

commit_message:
Bump os-ken to 2.0.0

That will avoid problems with eventlet 0.31.0 version, as seen during
the requirements upgrade.

Change-Id: I9a6798a6b0438149af8190dc90c70f79735bb01d
Closes-Bug: #1930195

commit_message:
[OVN] Set up routing on public bridge like OVS did

This fixes various reported and unreported issues with the new
behaviour.

Removes code repetition as well to pay off some technical debt.

Closes-Bug: #1930360
Change-Id: I726c532e96ca434520838ae8a35d5b88b6dd337b

Add deprecation warning in README file

master (Xena onwards) but continue supporting the
old stable branch until stable/wallaby.

[{'created': '2021-06-08 12:09:00.000000000', 'message': 'Add validations_result when running validations.

When merging [0], it was missed part of the solution submitted in [1]
removing the register: validations_result. As a consequence, if the
validations command fails then Ansible will show an error saying that
validations_result variable does not exist. This patch adds back
the parameter.

[0] - I47c1a2d0a8cc6618444b6301232079f69c5d8d6e
[1] - I7bac98032b84fadb6e42f8d790db3bba881dbc7b

Change-Id: I18bea0f88926f47fe2945bd8c127d6a372efa52f
'}, {'created': '2021-06-08 13:53:07.000000000', 'message': 'Add validations_result when running validations.

When merging [0], it was missed part of the solution submitted in [1]
removing the register: validations_result. As a consequence, if the
validations command fails then Ansible will show an error saying that
validations_result variable does not exist. This patch adds back
the parameter.
Also, it corrects the case when the validations_filtered parameter
does not contain any validation. In that case, the validation group
will be skipped.

[0] - I47c1a2d0a8cc6618444b6301232079f69c5d8d6e
[1] - I7bac98032b84fadb6e42f8d790db3bba881dbc7b

Change-Id: I18bea0f88926f47fe2945bd8c127d6a372efa52f
'}]
commit_message:
Add validations_result when running validations.

When merging [0], it was missed part of the solution submitted in [1]
removing the register: validations_result. As a consequence, if the
validations command fails then Ansible will show an error saying that
validations_result variable does not exist. This patch adds back
the parameter.
Also, it corrects the case when the validations_filtered parameter
does not contain any validation. In that case, the validation group
will be skipped.

[0] - I47c1a2d0a8cc6618444b6301232079f69c5d8d6e
[1] - I7bac98032b84fadb6e42f8d790db3bba881dbc7b

Change-Id: I18bea0f88926f47fe2945bd8c127d6a372efa52f

(1 comment)

Just a rebase, and a question.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-02-16 00:00:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2019-04-11 17:38:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

The interesting thing about this patch is that it actually goes against previous changes that were made specifically to block DLOs and symlinks in tempurls, so much so that the option is not even configurable as is the case here[1][2].

What's different here? Are the security concerns the same/different?

I'm putting a -1 just to signal that we should have a discussion before merging.

[1] - https://github.com/openstack/swift/commit/10b2939b433a4a79b4f7b97640b3d208cacfeffb
[2] - https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/common/middleware/tempurl.py#L321"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-02-20 05:03:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I feel like this change probably could have a bug # and should have a functest that demonstrates both the the api change, and the new behavior it enables.

I imagine at least for SLOs the security issues could (probably?) be addressed with account level scoped tempurl keys.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-02-20 06:41:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-02-20 17:16:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-02-20 17:20:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> I imagine at least for SLOs the security issues could (probably?) be addressed with account level scoped tempurl keys.

I don't think that'll cut it; the problem runs a bit deeper than that. AIUI, the way PUTs currently work (*regardless* of account vs container key) is:

* with no prefix, you're allowed to PUT (or HEAD) the single path included in the signature and
* with a prefix, you're allowed to PUT (or HEAD) any path that starts with the prefix included in the signature.

Since those PUTs are scrubbed [0][1][2] before sending them down the pipeline, we don't have to worry about subrequests or how they'd be auth'ed.

Allowing `multipart-manifest` (or `bulk-extract`!) query params through requires that we *do* start thinking about it, and as best I can tell, the implementation we settled on [3] was mainly designed around GETs. (Again, AIUI) we'll allow *any* subrequest within the container, and if the account key was used, that gets broadened to any subrequest within the entire *account*. So if you have a PUT tempurl for some path /v1/a/c/o, you can probe for object existence by trying to create an SLO with a body like

 [{"path": "c/some-well-known-name"}]

That will either 400 (because the object doesn't exist) or 201; in the latter case you can also HEAD the freshly-written SLO to determine the target object's size (fortunately, no metadata leaks and the ETag is at least hashed). If you were lucky enough to have a GET/PUT pair of tempurls for the same name, you could even fetch the object data! This seems like a substantial loosening of restrictions from where we currently are, even if it isn't quite as bad as CVE-2015-5223 (those DLOs are scary!).

So, maybe we re-think how tempurl scoping applies to subrequests. At first glance, it seems not-crazy to me that a prefix-based tempurl should be able to create an SLO provided all of the constituent segments start with the prefix. But I think that will require that we have different subrequest-scoping rules for PUT vs GET; which set of rules should then apply for POST and DELETE? How will we deal with HEAD, which ATM can be allowed based on a valid signature for any of these methods? Would it be weird that a pair of PUT-with-prefix and GET-no-prefix tempurls essentially escalates to a GET-with-prefix tempurl?

FWIW, I know Matt started playing around with func tests related to this in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/659499/

This is a giant can of worms :-(

[0] https://github.com/openstack/swift/commit/c4c66d81bdf41d7d509ddeae5a03a2b00ff26cc8
[1] https://github.com/openstack/swift/commit/10b2939b433a4a79b4f7b97640b3d208cacfeffb
[2] https://github.com/openstack/swift/commit/99b89aea1051208e3d71afa35fcd62035e702628
[3] https://github.com/openstack/swift/commit/d4409c0a046c6ce0e14e18c95efe2cd16cf120e8'}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2020-03-18 14:19:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2020-03-20 03:12:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

Looks okay to me, including the space-separated keys. The scenarios Tim is considering are concerning, but fortunately the allowed_headers list is empty by default.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2021-06-10 23:57:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}]

commit_message:
Preserve query params in tempurl

Before this commit, the tempurl middleware only preserved the
query parameters 'temp_url_sig', 'temp_url_expires' and
'filename'. With this behaviour, it is not possible to PUT
a manifest of an SLO, because this requires the query param
'multipart-manifest=put'.

With this commit, we allow the user to specify query params
in a white-space separated list. These query params are going
to be preserved through the proxy-server wsgi pipeline.

Change-Id: I3cea64a3d01b3a6365054340e165ddfca02df6c4
Closes-Bug: #1553714

[{'created': '2021-06-10 01:49:49.000000000', 'message': "Fix cinder's cephx keyring file permissions

This patch updates cinder's kolla permissions so that cinder can
access any cephx keyring associated with CephExternalMultiConfig
ceph clusters. The new approach parses the cluster names out of the
CephExternalMultiConfig array, and uses a wildcard to grant access
to all keys (regardless of the key name) defined for each cluster.
There is no risk of the wildcard granting improper access to a
privileged key (e.g. the admin key), because CephExternalMultiConfig
doesn't include privileged keys.

This patch replaces similar (but more restrictive) code added in
I73af5b868de629870a35d38f8436e7025aae791e. That patch allowed cinder
to access cephx keyrings associated with a new CinderRbdMultiConfig
parameter, but it didn't cover all potential use cases. For example,
in a DCN/Edge deployment, cinder services running at the edge need
access to the central site's client key in order to perform operations
like offline volume migration.

NOTE (pre-Wallaby):
The >= Wallaby versions of this patch tweaks code that was introduced
in Wallaby by I73af5b868de629870a35d38f8436e7025aae791e. Pre-Wallaby
versions of this patch _adds_ the tweaked code.

Closes-Bug: #1930620
Resolves: rhbz#1962304
Change-Id: I4423fcbd62b09ef323590fc740dd29e1a17777f5
(cherry picked from commit f1cd8006fec9f3f68cee21fc2139fb985b0b1fac)
(cherry picked from commit 74e3884b4a21a27262c48b4df8f0e369a5486f87)
Conflicts:
	deployment/cinder/cinder-common-container-puppet.yaml
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cinder's cephx keyring file permissions

This patch updates cinder's kolla permissions so that cinder can
access any cephx keyring associated with CephExternalMultiConfig
ceph clusters. The new approach parses the cluster names out of the
CephExternalMultiConfig array, and uses a wildcard to grant access
to all keys (regardless of the key name) defined for each cluster.
There is no risk of the wildcard granting improper access to a
privileged key (e.g. the admin key), because CephExternalMultiConfig
doesn't include privileged keys.

This patch replaces similar (but more restrictive) code added in
I73af5b868de629870a35d38f8436e7025aae791e. That patch allowed cinder
to access cephx keyrings associated with a new CinderRbdMultiConfig
parameter, but it didn't cover all potential use cases. For example,
in a DCN/Edge deployment, cinder services running at the edge need
access to the central site's client key in order to perform operations
like offline volume migration.

NOTE (pre-Wallaby):
The >= Wallaby versions of this patch tweaks code that was introduced
in Wallaby by I73af5b868de629870a35d38f8436e7025aae791e. Pre-Wallaby
versions of this patch _adds_ the tweaked code.

Closes-Bug: #1930620
Resolves: rhbz#1962304
Change-Id: I4423fcbd62b09ef323590fc740dd29e1a17777f5
(cherry picked from commit f1cd8006fec9f3f68cee21fc2139fb985b0b1fac)
(cherry picked from commit 74e3884b4a21a27262c48b4df8f0e369a5486f87)
Conflicts:
	deployment/cinder/cinder-common-container-puppet.yaml

subject: Fix incorrect formatting and a Python 3.10 failure
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 10342, 'name': 'Jay Faulkner', 'display_name': 'JayF', 'email': 'jay@jvf.cc', 'username': 'JayF'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! [{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-06-10 17:33:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2021-06-10 17:39:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build failed (check pipeline).

- R6515_bios_sushy https://stash.dellemc-community.org/logs/R6515_bios_sushy/31 : FAILURE in 5m 4s
- 14G_uefi_sushy https://stash.dellemc-community.org/logs/14G_uefi_sushy/35 : FAILURE in 0s

For 3rd party CI contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/DellEMC_Ironic_CI'}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2021-06-10 17:44:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I have no objection whatsoever to supporting python 3.10, or merging this fix as-is. I'm only voting +1 as I typically do not core review on sushy projects.

I will note, however, that we only declare support up to 3.8 in the setup.cfg: https://opendev.org/openstack/sushy/src/branch/master/setup.cfg#L22. Also, looking at https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/sushy/+/701221 since this hasn't had CI run yet, it looks like we only run unit tests on up to py37.

Can we, as a follow-up, update the setup.cfg and perhaps CI as well to reflect sushy being run under newer python versions? That should help guard against us having these kinds of unexpected issues in the future (and honestly, if Fedora is shipping sushy+Py3.10, we should probably get that stuff going soon)."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-06-10 18:05:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14629, 'date': '2021-06-10 18:26:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- hpe-gen10-dsvm-sushy-standalone-wholedisk-uefi-redfish-virtual-media-direct-python3 https://hpproliant.github.io/hpeproliant.github.io/logs/55/795855/1/check/hpe-gen10-dsvm-sushy-standalone-wholedisk-uefi-redfish-virtual-media-direct-python3/6594efe/6594efe.html : SUCCESS in 49m 43s'}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2021-06-10 22:11:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build failed (check pipeline).

- 14G_uefi_sushy https://stash.dellemc-community.org/logs/14G_uefi_sushy/36 : SUCCESS in 2h 43m 3s
- R6515_bios_sushy https://stash.dellemc-community.org/logs/R6515_bios_sushy/32 : FAILURE in 1h 31m 37s

For 3rd party CI contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/DellEMC_Ironic_CI'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-10 17:33:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix incorrect formatting and a Python 3.10 failure

While testing on Python 3.10 two issues were spotted:
1) Missing formatting specifiers in registry logging
2) Reliance on the exact way HTTP status are converted to string

Fedora bug https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1969148

Change-Id: I22d0033691ee0ba34fca14ac14904e33342a584a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect formatting and a Python 3.10 failure

While testing on Python 3.10 two issues were spotted:
1) Missing formatting specifiers in registry logging
2) Reliance on the exact way HTTP status are converted to string

Fedora bug https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1969148

Change-Id: I22d0033691ee0ba34fca14ac14904e33342a584a

commit_message:
New location of the default log directory.

Json callback now expects the log directory to
be $HOME/validations. Just as defined in the validations libs.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/validations-libs/+/795093

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id1d39fd907eb154a601da68e9f75756cccfbf91c

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-02 13:56:16.000000000', 'message': 'Mark fullstack test_l2_agent_restart as unstable

With linuxbridge agent the connectivity test fails often after l2 agent
restart, so mark it as unstable until the root cause is found.

commit_message:
Mark fullstack test_l2_agent_restart as unstable

With linuxbridge agent the connectivity test fails often after l2 agent
restart, so mark it as unstable until the root cause is found.

Change-Id: Ida3193acac2fa22bbfd4b18ef3a3bceafe46d3ec
Related-Bug: #1928764

commit_message:
Fixing the recursive path handling.

The patch f2830c52446b1bd57383e91e6eb3da84cfdab1c7 introduced
several potentially breaking bugs, which have to be fixed.
Namely, several of the termination conditionals lacked proper
return statements.

In addition to the fix of the previously describe issues
the following changes are included to prevent more arising in
the future.

Every major behavioral branch now has a dedicated log statement.
Test coverage included.
Expanded docstrings.
Increased expressiveness of var names.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie7471361acf1f4ae197e76b22eb7ba4d3f62fe92

commit_message:
Fix typo that breaks Octavia db sync step

The filename for the kolla_config octavia json file was incorrect
causing there to be no database initialization for octavia deployments.

Closes-Bug: #1931428
Change-Id: Ic18f07f01a2b4053d042dc0a1b783b397d985d9e

Like we used to do when configuring Ganesha via puppet [1] this
change is making the new tripleo_ceph_client role set the Manila
keyring mount uid/gid so that Ganesha can correctly map root
permissions from CephFS to NFS.

1. https://github.com/openstack/puppet-tripleo/blob/master/manifests/profile/base/manila/share.pp#L145-L147

Closes-Bug: 1894374
Change-Id: I86b1b75c9d807356e9a1f1901bc7e8856f0c0961
(cherry picked from commit 31f4a9153e4e6ba3368114d19f5a11e362ff28aa)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensures mount uid/git for Manila keyring are correctly set

Like we used to do when configuring Ganesha via puppet [1] this
change is making the new tripleo_ceph_client role set the Manila
keyring mount uid/gid so that Ganesha can correctly map root
permissions from CephFS to NFS.

1. https://github.com/openstack/puppet-tripleo/blob/master/manifests/profile/base/manila/share.pp#L145-L147

Closes-Bug: 1894374
Change-Id: I86b1b75c9d807356e9a1f1901bc7e8856f0c0961
(cherry picked from commit 31f4a9153e4e6ba3368114d19f5a11e362ff28aa)

commit_message:
Add alertmanager port parameter

During the monitoring stack configuration, cephadm is able to accept
grafana/prometheus/alertmanager ports as parameters.
For this reason (and to make sure we control ports from TripleO), the
missing alertmanager port is explicitly defined, and it will be
processed by [1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-ansible/blob/master/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_cephadm/tasks/monitoring.yaml#L81

Change-Id: Ifa75e8436f60697280f440a24926ed86ef3806c0

Adds upgrades jobs to periodic

This patch adds standalone-upgrade and
undercloud-upgrade jobs for victoria and
ussuri release to periodic.

commit_message:
Pass custom CephConfigPath parameter to ceph-nfs role

This is necessary for the systemd service to mount the correct
location on the host

commit_message:
Use and ownership info for the ceph_pools_pg_protection module

Adjusted the module level 'DOCUMENTATION' attribute
to improve readability/style.

commit_message:
Test container updates when delorean-current does not exist

delorean-current does not exist is downstream jobs.
This review set_fact to edit the default value
before adding component repos.

commit_message:
Set ganesha idmap.conf file path and overrides

This patch is a follow up of [1], which added two additional
parameters with the purpose of defining the idmap.conf location
and some potential overrides that can be applied via [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/773999
[2] https://review.opendev.org/795233

Depends-On: I2b118e6e2184e70d5bccb4ab3cdb7e868ac731e2
Change-Id: I7aa97142224f040abe6123450ef13ec5959a9c5d

commit_message:
Remove the post-update groups.

For the update it's not required to define the
DockerInsecureRegistryAddress parameter.

Change-Id: I329d56a266a62327ab3ba88ac726729624d2a766

- Keeping PY2 support with six

commit_message:
Fix PY3 issue

- In PY3 the output of subprocess.Popen is a type bytes, but
strip() method requires a type str.

- Keeping PY2 support with six

Change-Id: I2ae523ff019ff0a1944dcec905b3ca797bf9b96f
(cherry picked from commit 4fb0ae6bb61c09d7f4e4fc2ba70c137909ec3449)

commit_message:
Fix PY3 issue

- In PY3 the output of subprocess.Popen is a type bytes, but
strip() method requires a type str.

Story: 2008017
Task: 40669

Change-Id: I297c30044df9a94baa645a1a27de10bb49038440
(cherry picked from commit 679f09a3a8f6c89b3b729b60d2174cb4ae3d891c)

commit_message:
Add access rules validation for container driver

Adds LDAP security service validation when updating access rules in the
container driver. Before granting access, the driver will search for the
allowed user to check if a corresponding cn entry exists in the LDAP
directory.

Change-Id: I4e3abadbde780b54500eb7ce7660f99fcf07b3cc

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-04 17:54:52.000000000', 'message': 'Always redirect project contributor docs to latest

It doesn't really make sense to publish multiple versions of
contributor documentation, but when contributor documentation is
included in branched projects this is precisely what we end up with.
Luckily, the recent work to standardize project contributor docs
puts them under a consistent subtree of the each project's
documentation, so we can easily match on them.

In order to avoid things like web search results and stale bookmarks
sending unwary users to outdated versions of contributor
information, just always redirect any old series to "latest"
instead.

Change-Id: If55ec3d4e0c98e43e985e293f23813794315450d
'}, {'created': '2021-06-04 22:58:16.000000000', 'message': 'Always redirect project contributor docs to latest

Change-Id: If55ec3d4e0c98e43e985e293f23813794315450d

commit_message:
Always redirect project contributor docs to latest

It doesn't really make sense to publish multiple versions of
contributor documentation, but when contributor documentation is
included in branched projects this is precisely what we end up with.
Luckily, the recent work to standardize project contributor docs
puts them under a consistent subtree of the each project's
documentation, so we can easily match on them.

In order to avoid things like web search results and stale bookmarks
sending unwary users to outdated versions of contributor
information, just always redirect any old series to "latest"
instead.

Change-Id: If55ec3d4e0c98e43e985e293f23813794315450d

commit_message:
Improve the client performance on large clouds

This patch fixes the client performance when used on large clouds.
Previously the client was pulling down a full list of resources when
mapping names to IDs and filtering on the client side. This is inefficient
as it is transfering many more records than are necessary.
This patch uses the filter capabilities of the OpenStack APIs to target
the search for a resource ID.

Change-Id: I6e68113aea9ce27beb6691bd2a398bf276a23ae2

commit_message:
Support pagination for 'list' API calls

Fix 'list' CLI calls when API calls are paginated.
Fix some UUID or name lookups that failed when the number of resources
exceeded 'pagination_max_limit'.

Story 2008892
Task 42489

Change-Id: Ica7c8c953c11af4400b224ad942023f69a72ae02

commit_message:
Remove "mitogen" library installation from "docs" job

Since pyroute 0.6.2, this dependency is not needed anymore. The
pyroute version is bumped both in requirements and doc/requirements.

This patch bumps the pyroute2 version to 0.6.4 (newest version
provided in upper-requirements).

Change-Id: I627e902e32fe59c6829c3bc92af19abff4b70f9a
Related-Bug: #1928913

commit_message:
[DHCP] Fix cleanup_deleted_ports method

Assume that only one port is deleted within 24 hours, in method
cleanup_deleted_ports the port removes from deleted_ports but not
removes from deleted_ports_ts
In this fix ports older than 1 day will be dropped from
deleted_ports and deleted_ports_ts properly

Closes-Bug: #1930838
Change-Id: I1af32e72abb9f101f9729aa6d1354c33a95c98ee

commit_message:
Add ruamel.yaml to global-requirements.txt

This Python library is now a requirement for building
documentation (ansible-autodoc) for the following project:
- openstack/tripleo-validations
- openstack/validations-common

ruamel.yaml is a YAML 1.2 loader/dumper package for Python.

The library is actively maintained, with almost a weekly release. It is
compatible with Python 2 and 3 and licensed under the MIT.

https://pypi.org/project/ruamel.yaml/

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I208b00629493953a502f8b95756820ae0d9a9cb6

commit_message:
Define region for Magnum trust

We were missing region definition for trust section which resulted in
issues in multiregion deployments

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/795137

Change-Id: I8a569f47c0f3100f4c49dde01c58b31338ab1182

[{'created': '2021-04-20 16:14:40.000000000', 'message': "Debian api_uwsgi_config: Switch to :ini_setting

On each puppet run, I'm seeing:
value changed ['12'] to '12' (corrective)

Therefore, this patch switches from :openstackconfig to :ini_setting

commit_message:
Debian api_uwsgi_config: Switch to :ini_setting

On each puppet run, I'm seeing:
value changed ['12'] to '12' (corrective)

Therefore, this patch switches from :openstackconfig to :ini_setting
to make the 2nd run not changing anything.

Change-Id: Ibd5f33715c856aba5a6c34b74d3d49ceb09e5f28

strip() method requires a type str.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-08 18:54:17.000000000', 'message': 'Move rabbitmq healthcheck to something more modern

Rabbitmq healthcheck when used against newer rabbitmq versions (seen at
least with 3.8.16) is using old interface "rabbitmqctl
node_health_check" which is deprecated and logs the following:

  2021-06-08 18:25:55.014 [warning] <0.5504.0> rabbitmqctl node_health_check and its HTTP API counterpart are
  DEPRECATED. See https://www.rabbitmq.com/monitoring.html#health-checks for replacement options.

Let's switch to "rabbitmq-diagnostics check_running" which should be a
sufficiently solid check without being too complex/heavy on rabbit
itself.

Change-Id: Ibaad817f52930380e659180fd8c52dca131cd4f8
Closes-Bug: #1931298
'}]
commit_message:
Move rabbitmq healthcheck to something more modern

Rabbitmq healthcheck when used against newer rabbitmq versions (seen at
least with 3.8.16) is using old interface "rabbitmqctl
node_health_check" which is deprecated and logs the following:

  2021-06-08 18:25:55.014 [warning] <0.5504.0> rabbitmqctl node_health_check and its HTTP API counterpart are
  DEPRECATED. See https://www.rabbitmq.com/monitoring.html#health-checks for replacement options.

Let's switch to "rabbitmq-diagnostics check_running" which should be a
sufficiently solid check without being too complex/heavy on rabbit
itself.

Change-Id: Ibaad817f52930380e659180fd8c52dca131cd4f8
Closes-Bug: #1931298

commit_message:
Fix default_route_network - default to ctlplane

When not using metalsmith to deploy nodes, the default
for default_route_network was [], causing nodes to be
configured without a default route.

Fix up the default to 'ctlplane' by changeing the default
value when doing the dictonary lookup.

Closes-Bug: #1931046
Change-Id: I10140c6a587e4df1c91c064c5e899564825949ca

commit_message:
Clean up ifcfg-eth0

If ifcfg-eth0 is defined but does not exist, this can cause the nodes to
fail to get an IP address on initial provisioning. This patch removes it
when the image is built to ensure we don't end up with a bad interface
network script.

Change-Id: I3b8cb5f8c413c109da1228878db9cff4d439273b
Closes-Bug: #1931495

commit_message:
[WIP][DNM] Implement a entry point wrapper with timeout

TODO: testing, documentation and release not

This new entry point decorator allows to define a maximum execution
time for the passed method. If time is exceeded, a "PrivsepTimeout"
is raised.

Related-Bug: #1921154
Change-Id: I32b70c9d15bc5ced8ae2cc8c252db91c7b246d55

[{'created': '2021-06-08 14:23:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix py27 compatability for train

Train release of OpenStack is intended to support compatability
with python2.7 and we inadvertently broke it earlier.

Due to a broken gate, we created a change which removed the py27
jobs, bandit, and lower constraints checking due to multiple
gates failing all at once. Ide0f6c38a59ae6486fa33cfb19b383d022e57d5a

The removal of the py27 change was due to Bandit 1.7.0 which
dropped py2 support. We should have restricted Bandit in our
test-requirements.txt at that time.

As such, this commit addresses that, plus python3 only exception
names which slipped in on a backport breaking py27 compatability.

Change-Id: I4a441495d078b9c46b8ad443fc0e7862efd12bde

Change-Id: I4a441495d078b9c46b8ad443fc0e7862efd12bde

commit_message:
Fix py27 compatability for train

Train release of OpenStack is intended to support compatability
with python2.7 and we inadvertently broke it earlier.

Due to a broken gate, we created a change which removed the py27
jobs, bandit, and lower constraints checking due to multiple
gates failing all at once. Ide0f6c38a59ae6486fa33cfb19b383d022e57d5a

The removal of the py27 change was due to Bandit 1.7.0 which
dropped py2 support. We should have restricted Bandit in our
test-requirements.txt at that time.

As such, this commit addresses that, plus python3 only exception
names which slipped in on a backport breaking py27 compatability.

Change-Id: I4a441495d078b9c46b8ad443fc0e7862efd12bde

commit_message:
Make networking-ovn-tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode non-voting

This job has been failing with an unrelated problem for some time now,
let's make it non-voting to unblock the gate.

Currently failure for this job seems to be:

2021-06-08 08:48:17.212827 | LOOP [Check if we have a repo]
2021-06-08 08:48:17.289292 | primary | ERROR
2021-06-08 08:48:17.290339 | primary | {
2021-06-08 08:48:17.290444 | primary |   "msg": "dict2items requires a
dictionary, got <class 'ansible.template.AnsibleUndefined'> instead."

2021-06-08 08:48:17.346063 | secondary | }
2021-06-08 08:48:17.346160 | secondary | ERROR: Ignoring Errors

Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Set fixture paths for unit tests

This change defines manifest_dir and module_path expicitly in unit
tests so that modules installed under fixtures directory is properly
loaded.

Closes-Bug: #1930403
Change-Id: I549c03eebd718994f39831d24387a928bc109c08
(cherry picked from commit c6d27c16f956cfec075d478a4c32f989f58ca819)

Update distro mirrors to match release

We also move CentOS repos configuration to vars to align
place where release needs to be updated with other distros.

commit_message:
Mount rabbitmq TLS secret

Mount rabbitmq TLS secret to openstack services which support internal
TLS. Once internal TLS support is added to other service, the TLSed 
rabbitmq support should be added.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/+/795188

Change-Id: I9aa272e365f846746f2e06aa7b7010db730e17df

commit_message:
Payloads for PORT: BEFORE_CREATE and PRECOMMIT_CREATE

This patch switches the code over to the payload style of callbacks
for PORT BEFORE_CREATE and PRECOMMIT_CREATE events

Change-Id: Ia6903be1af4de575ab9d82c9cb0c88290d07abb3

commit_message:
ovn: Don't use dict.remove() for filtering dhcp ports in db-sync

The db-sync script removes ovnmeta ports because sometimes removing
reserved_dhcp_port in the loop doesn't work.

Change-Id: I78673b6a85f1c872e70026da82124d1ba2326562
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix Docker builds

The default nodeset was just changed to focal [1], which in the absence
of the python-is-python3 package doesn't provide a python binary.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/opendev/base-jobs/+/789098

(cherry picked from commit 7d21e505e8a8f750e88978c80f7ac47d73d7f2db)

commit_message:
Fix Docker builds

The default nodeset was just changed to focal [1], which in the absence
of the python-is-python3 package doesn't provide a python binary.

commit_message:
CI: test base container image build in seed jobs

Currently we do not have any coverage of building container images. This
change adds a basic test of building the base image to the seed jobs.

A potential future enhancement could involve pushing to a local registry
running on the seed.

Change-Id: Id7378dd844aca7cb5634535308eba0f60342c81d
(cherry picked from commit c6c1cde3f9cf8bb232071b78ab89c79a0c7689b8)

subject: Support UnionTech OS server enterprise when run 'prechecks' step.
messages: [{'account_id': 33619, 'date': '2021-06-10 13:19:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-06-10 14:12:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2\n\nHi, UnionTech OS is not supported by the core team. Firstly, we require the supported distribution to be testable in CI. Secondly, we really need more people cored in Kolla Ansible to increase the support scope. Thirdly, if it's a Debian-based OS, then it should work as Debian does - you should rather trick Ansible into believing this is still Debian so that it follows the right code paths."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-10 13:19:11.000000000', 'message': "Support UnionTech OS server enterprise when run 'prechecks' step.

UnionTech is a well-known operating system manufacturer in China, which is a debian-based release.
We hope that the UnionTech OS server enterprise can pass the 'prechecks' step. Now the UnionTech
OS has passed the 'prechecks' step and can be successfully deployed.

Change-Id: I46e5dbb96bda07ccbc8319168eac16f0f8f27852
"}]
commit_message:
Support UnionTech OS server enterprise when run 'prechecks' step.

UnionTech is a well-known operating system manufacturer in China, which is a debian-based release.
We hope that the UnionTech OS server enterprise can pass the 'prechecks' step. Now the UnionTech
OS has passed the 'prechecks' step and can be successfully deployed.

Change-Id: I46e5dbb96bda07ccbc8319168eac16f0f8f27852

commit_message:
Revert "Add network parameter to some of the ML2 API methods"

This reverts commit 5adf98e857a2ddb923ba0d47a042027122962a5a.

Reason for revert: After longer thinking about related bug,
we realized that this isn't Neutron bug really.
So change proposed in the 5adf98e857a2ddb923ba0d47a042027122962a5a
isn't really needed.
See comment [1] for more details.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1906318/comments/5

Change-Id: I01cb252c423cac6a529a785d5dce7f6b3cbe3b5d
Related-Bug: #1906318

[{'created': '2019-02-28 12:28:18.000000000', 'message': 'Remove all glance-registry related changes

Removed all glance-registry related changes from puppet-glance, since
Glance Registry has become redundant & been deprecated from
glance due to support of Glance V2. The registry code base is
also going to be removed from Glance project once all the
dependencies removed from other projects.

Change-Id: Iee58bf3efa6495f034bae31269a0d9416dc0f5fe
Related-Bug: #1808911
'}]
commit_message:
Remove all glance-registry related changes

Removed all glance-registry related changes from puppet-glance, since
Glance Registry has become redundant & been deprecated from
glance due to support of Glance V2. The registry code base is
also going to be removed from Glance project once all the
dependencies removed from other projects.

Change-Id: Iee58bf3efa6495f034bae31269a0d9416dc0f5fe
Related-Bug: #1808911

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-08 02:22:18.000000000', 'message': "Remove existing env vars before scale down

Existing environment variables cause scale down
failures. This is an issue if the user sources
the stackrc file instead of just exporting
OS_CLOUD=undercloud. Since we rely on clouds.yaml
for the scale down to work. The env vars set by
stackrc need to be removed.

I also added a task to reset them after we're
done to improve the overall experience.

Closes-Bug: #1931172
Change-Id: I9baefb9b9ab7b21b58b48b29f1f70c8c19005340
"}]
commit_message:
Remove existing env vars before scale down

Existing environment variables cause scale down
failures. This is an issue if the user sources
the stackrc file instead of just exporting
OS_CLOUD=undercloud. Since we rely on clouds.yaml
for the scale down to work. The env vars set by
stackrc need to be removed.

I also added a task to reset them after we're
done to improve the overall experience.

Closes-Bug: #1931172
Change-Id: I9baefb9b9ab7b21b58b48b29f1f70c8c19005340

commit_message:
Replace Fedora test image with F32

Fedora 31 was retired and the image is gone from mirrors.
heat-cfntools have been dropped from fedora images, disable
the test till that's resolved.

Fix contradicting lower constraints to make lower-constraints job pass.

Change-Id: Id869f83a46454897c2fe7a532eebfa2863befe5e
(cherry picked from commit 61e53c4eca3bc4f0c60754269cb2811afc569705)
(cherry picked from commit 779b39c975c32e8fd0a3982197787c294cf92589)

commit_message:
Add compatibility for 2.10

If you pip install ansible (not base) to get ansible 2.10, the
collection is available so we need to import that differently than it is
currently imported for 2.9

Change-Id: I25b203882b06a9b98541e92c24be52d92858d8c1

subject: Move prefetch container to pre deploy
messages:
[{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-04-07 16:28:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-04-07 16:29:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-04-07 18:36:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-04-08 08:34:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm not sure what was the failure. Shall iptables rules creation be moved to the pre deploy step as well?"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-04-08 08:47:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Or was that the missing container image prepare contents?

Prefetch pulls from image-serve:

Apr 07 18:07:38 underCloud.localDomain ansible-podman_image[50867]: Invoked with force=True name=192.168.24.1:8787/tripleomaster/openstack-haproxy:a96366960d5f9b08f78075b7560514e7 validate_certs=False tag=latest pull=True 

But it is populated later, by external_deploy_steps_tasks_step1.yaml. So should we move the prepare container images to pre deploy as well?'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-04-08 13:44:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

yea the problem is the prepare bits don't run until external deploy step tasks which run after this. so this doesn't work atm"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-06-10 14:25:10.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

the framework currently doesn't allow for this to happen in a good spot."}]

commit_message:
Move prefetch container to pre deploy

Now that we've added pre deployment steps, we can move the container
fetching from step 1 to the pre deploy steps.

Change-Id: Icceeff82eef676881853796b4f7142c254f6818e

subject: Speed up server details
messages:
[{'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2021-05-16 11:02:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-05-18 14:39:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(10 comments)

Thanks Norman for writing up a spec. I have couple of comments and open questions inline.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-05-18 22:04:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(9 comments)

few more things to fill in spec in addition to what gibi already pointed out. and my opinion on POST /servers and sec grp list APIs.'}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2021-05-19 02:16:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2021-05-19 03:12:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2021-05-19 03:16:20.000000000', 'content': 'Assignee added: norman shen <yshxxsjt715@gmail.com>'}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2021-05-19 03:24:01.000000000', 'content': 'Assignee deleted: norman shen <yshxxsjt715@gmail.com>'}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2021-05-19 03:37:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2021-05-21 00:21:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(11 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2021-05-25 13:55:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-05-25 14:18:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Couple of style comments. The -1 is due to my question about changing how the old microversion behaves, i.e. it will return only ids instead of a mix of names and ids.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-05-26 00:46:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-05-26 15:02:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Good idea. Couple of nits and you can't change from names to IDs for existing responses. Fix those and we're golden, IMO"}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2021-05-27 00:45:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2021-05-27 01:15:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2021-05-27 01:16:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(9 comments)

thank you very much for the feedback. the original thought for caching security group
id, although confusing, is to avoid extra call to security group ids, in the fear that 
it may cause other unexpected performance degrade.

besides, I am thinking returns security group id is more natural because neutron seems
to allow security group having the same name..'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-06-02 09:54:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Looks good to me.'}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2021-06-02 10:00:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I am doubting if caching security group is a good idea...
will extra serialization overhead makes the cpu even slower....'}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2021-06-02 10:02:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

moreover, notifications requires meta to be string values while new security groups will be string array which will cause problems for example, during upgrade...'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-06-03 16:01:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: -Code-Review

> Patch Set 6:
> 
> I am doubting if caching security group is a good idea...
> will extra serialization overhead makes the cpu even slower....

So you say we should not add caching for the old microversion just drop the SG from the new microversion?'}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2021-06-06 04:17:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> Patch Set 6: -Code-Review
> 
> > Patch Set 6:
> > 
> > I am doubting if caching security group is a good idea...
> > will extra serialization overhead makes the cpu even slower....
> 
> So you say we should not add caching for the old microversion just drop the SG from the new microversion?

after some basic testing (running serialization and deserialization in a roll 10,000,0000 times), it should save some time. but not as good as remove security groups completely. still need some further investigation though.'}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2021-06-06 04:18:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> Patch Set 6:
> 
> I am doubting if caching security group is a good idea...
> will extra serialization overhead makes the cpu even slower....

I would like to recall this statement.... but apparently gerrit does not allow delete comments....'}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2021-06-07 02:52:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I think caching security groups still works, apparently my demo code has a bug
and after fixing it, server detail almost as fast as removing security groups
from server detail.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-06-09 07:03:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

> Patch Set 6:
> 
> I think caching security groups still works, apparently my demo code has a bug
> and after fixing it, server detail almost as fast as removing security groups
> from server detail.

Thanks for the info. Then I'm plugging back my +2"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-06-09 22:24:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

lgtm, thanks. leaving +W for stephenfin in case he has any comment on updated one.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-06-10 14:10:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)'}]

Speed up server details

Speed up server details by caching security group
name in info_cache and also add a new microversion.

commit_message:
Cloudkitty role cleanup and config updates

The Cloudkitty role has been lacking some attention for a while
causing some of the configuration and examples outdated.

Now that Cloudkitty playbook and dashboard can be installed using
OSA without running any additional playbooks from this repository
i have removed those from here.

Change-Id: I0fe96c318273f0016d93cf043bda74feb11c63f8

commit_message:
Bump ovs and ovn versions to 2.15 for FFWD.

A new openvswitch and ovn version has been released, 2.15. As during the
leapp upgrade we tell leapp which version of ovs and ovn to install in order
to safe some restarts we now need to update the version in the
UpgradeLeappToInstall Heat parameter.

(cherry picked from commit c214e99b224e85a2059c2849aa5b356c1cb4f3c9)
Resolves: rhbz#1966476
Change-Id: I50cfc8d33efe80b0ac98347f230c68af9a561574

commit_message:
Changed minversion in tox to 3.18.0

The patch bumps min version of tox to 3.18.0 in order to
replace tox's whitelist_externals by allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

Change-Id: Iff3cda953dc52a0950ea2c615df8a67a7069c206

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-09 21:37:45.000000000', 'message': 'HA minor update: fix bad pcs invocation

When a HA resource is in failed stated, the minor update
should normally try to restart it but the associated
pcs invocation is currently invalid, so the resource never
gets a chance to be restarted.

Use the right pcs call to fix this minor update use case.

Change-Id: Iaf85807d067898bbab6d76ab40bc070e845a8b38
Closes-Bug: #1931500
'}]
commit_message:
HA minor update: fix bad pcs invocation

When a HA resource is in failed stated, the minor update
should normally try to restart it but the associated
pcs invocation is currently invalid, so the resource never
gets a chance to be restarted.

Use the right pcs call to fix this minor update use case.

Change-Id: Iaf85807d067898bbab6d76ab40bc070e845a8b38
Closes-Bug: #1931500

commit_message:
BnR Added a nfs validation when the nfs server is installed

Added a simple validation, the Backupnode group needs to be configured. Besides the name
of the group can be configured by parameter.

Change-Id: Ie0e3f25976464121e27f73765ccd271557d60e96

subject: Check the target root device with smartctl
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 10342, 'name': 'Jay Faulkner', 'display_name': 'JayF', 'email': 'jay@jvf.cc', 'username': 'JayF'}, {'_account_id': 11292, 'name': 'Arne Wiebalck', 'email': 'Arne.Wiebalck@cern.ch', 'username': 'wiebalck'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23851, 'name': 'Riccardo Pittau', 'email': 'elfosardo@gmail.com', 'username': 'elfosardo'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-06-01 11:50:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-06-01 13:56:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2021-06-01 14:13:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks, Dmitry!

How about logging the smartctl output upon failure? IIRC, utils.execute will only log in debug mode (which I assume to be off under normal circumstances). Otherwise, we would now need to boot the node again to get more details about what is wrong with the disk, rather than just checking the logs.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-06-01 15:14:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2021-06-02 06:36:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2021-06-02 08:43:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Thanks, Dmitry!'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-06-02 15:24:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2021-06-02 15:30:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2021-06-03 08:06:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2021-06-03 08:11:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2021-06-03 14:10:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck mmmm'}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2021-06-03 17:26:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I'm glad I got a chance to see this.

I do not think this should be done by default. There are bad HDD's out there which report invalid smartctl information, and enabling this feature by default will break IPA's ability to deploy to these HDDs.

Can we please add a configuration for disabling this (maybe on a per-node level? IDK), and preferably leave it disabled by default?"}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2021-06-03 17:27:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2021-06-03 17:27:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2021-06-03 17:28:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Sidebar: Is there a way for me to un-workflow a patch someone else has +A'd that I don't want merging?"}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-06-03 17:51:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-06-03 17:52:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4:
> 
> Sidebar: Is there a way for me to un-workflow a patch someone else has +A'd that I don't want merging?

Apply WF-1 ?"}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-06-03 17:59:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1
> 
> I'm glad I got a chance to see this.
> 
> I do not think this should be done by default. There are bad HDD's out there which report invalid smartctl information, and enabling this feature by default will break IPA's ability to deploy to these HDDs.
> 
> Can we please add a configuration for disabling this (maybe on a per-node level? IDK), and preferably leave it disabled by default?

This is also a concern of mine. I *think* most of my concern would be okay if we don't fail on Bit 1 being set by smartctl because it doesn't necessarily mean that the drive has failed, as it is device open failed, or no IDENTIFY DEVICE structure response, or in low power mode. Obviously, it supports a number of technologies, for example I just found out it supports NVME, but we still have people out there using fibrechannel arrays, and some controllers may grok the SMART request, or not.  If they don't, then this change is suddenly operationally breaking when there storage system is perfectly fine. Which in my mind goes back to ensuring bit 1 being returned does not (I guess, exit code 2 in an integer?) create a hard failure."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-06-03 18:00:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 32177, 'date': '2021-06-03 21:45:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Thank you for the patch Dmitry and for your comments Julia and Jay. My POV:
* having an option to control this behaviour certainly sounds like a good idea as it will allow operators to fine-tune behaviour to what their hardware is doing
* In general I would not be ruling out having this on by default, I think it is a useful feature and if a device is mistakenly reporting failure, to me that is a failure nonetheless
* however in cases of no hard failure, just poor smartctl support perhaps we should be logging a warning instead of failing deployment. Making this another config option may make sense, but I'm in two minds about this, may be one knob too many.
@Dmitry @Jay @Julia what are your thoughts on this?"}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2021-06-03 21:59:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

IMO, a better approach to implementing this is:

- Not be done unconditionally on all machines (e.g. off by default)
- Be implemented as an optional step that could be applied to deploy or cleaning

But that's my $.02. My primary requirement for approval is making the behavior optional... but I don't think it should be enabled by default either (but there is a lot of room to convince me otherwise)."}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2021-06-04 05:00:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review -Workflow

removing +W based on recent comments'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2021-06-04 06:04:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review

Removing +2 for now.

I guess that most deployments have contracts with their vendors/suppliers about when a disk should be replaced, and I would not be surprised if this is "smart health check says the disk is
broken" in many places. For us this is one of the cases, for instance. As also mentioned, in our deployment we run a disk burn-in before the node goes into prod, with the idea this reveals broken drives. Unlikely, but not impossible ofc, that drives break while waiting for deployment after. I believe the idea of this change, however, was to catch issues upon re-deployment when you cannot run a full verification.

Making this check optional (for deploy here and for a clean step later) is a good suggestion as it allows deployments to adjust to their needs.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-06-04 09:59:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> I do not think this should be done by default. There are bad HDD's out there which report invalid smartctl information

We only fail if smartctl explicitly reports "disk failure". Is it the case for these devices or do they report a different error code?'}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2021-06-04 14:58:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4:
> 
> > I do not think this should be done by default. There are bad HDD's out there which report invalid smartctl information
> 
> We only fail if smartctl explicitly reports "disk failure". Is it the case for these devices or do they report a different error code?

I have had hardware that reported disk failures via SMART out of the box. Usually lower quality SATADOM type modules. That's obviously the hardwares' fault, but we shouldn't paint operators with crappy hardware into a corner.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-06-07 09:05:42.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-06-10 13:47:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4:
> 
> > Patch Set 4:
> > 
> > > I do not think this should be done by default. There are bad HDD's out there which report invalid smartctl information
> > 
> > We only fail if smartctl explicitly reports "disk failure". Is it the case for these devices or do they report a different error code?
> 
> I have had hardware that reported disk failures via SMART out of the box. Usually lower quality SATADOM type modules. That's obviously the hardwares' fault, but we shouldn't paint operators with crappy hardware into a corner.

I agree we shouldn't paint people with problematic hardware in a corner, but think think that would be more reason to have a configuration option so on a per node basis an operator can acknowledge "hey, i know this may be a problem." I do think it is semi-reasonable for us to check the devices but personally I've never seen a sata device be in failed state and actually have a working IO interface to really query. I'm sure my experiences were likely somewhat edge cases, but mostly "pending fail" was the state I'd find disks and of course if they were re-seated or completely powered off, they would be "I'm good again!" in most cases at least for a few weeks or months. (https://twitter.com/ashinclouds/status/1402260136538873858)'}]

commit_message:
Use external PKI role to manage haproxy self-signed certificates

The external PKI role can generate a self signed CA and Intermediate
certificate, and then create a server certificate for haproxy if
no defaults are overridden.

The new openstack_pki_* settings allow an external self signed CA
to be used, but still create valid haproxy server certificates from
that external CA in an openstack-ansible deployment.

The original beheviour providing user supplied certificates in the
haproxy_user_ssl_* variables will still work, disabling the generation
of certificates but using the external PKI role to just install the
supplied certs and keys.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/788031
Change-Id: I7482f55e991bacd9dccd2748c236dcd9d01124f3

commit_message:
Enable ovsdb debug messages in functional and fullstack

Enable the configuration flag "ovsdb_debug" for functional and
fullstack tests. If enable, NeutronOvsdbIdl won't define any log
level when setting up the logger; if not "max_level" is defined,
all messages are logged.

Change-Id: I1185c1ca2556e2aed27051efd98a1d141f5298c9
Related-Bug: #1802640
(cherry picked from commit cf36bd4ca52bec4a707c35df261b8a2630850e68)

commit_message:
Use ansible-role-pki to generate SSL certificates

Supports two scenarios:

1) variables defined in defaults/main.yml are sufficient to create
a root/intermediate CA certificate for rabbitmq when this role
is used outside openstack-ansible.

2) when:

openstack_pki_dir
openstack_pki_setup_host
openstack_pki_authorities
openstack_pki_service_intermediate_cert_name

are defined, an external CA already created on the deploy host
with a previous run of ansible-role-pki will be used as the CA.

Server certificates for the rabbitmq instances are created from the
data in rabbitmq_pki_certificates in both situations:

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/788031
Change-Id: I4cb7c48a74a307217b645cb8528fdbb0f7b9f596

commit_message:
API "subnet-segmentid-writable" should inherit field definition

API extensions "subnet-segmentid-writable" should inherit field
"segment_id" definition from the parent API extension, "segment".
This patch fixes how this field is defined, re-introducing the
missing key "is_filter", present in the parent API.

Change-Id: Ib8840e5e884100943f6e0cfbee1737a70c0d3874
Closes-Bug: #1931259

Python 3: Use byte instead of string.

In Python 3, output of popen.communicate is byte instead of str.

Story: 2008017

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-08 20:26:18.000000000', 'message': 'set ganesha idmap.conf file path and overrides

Traditionally,  Ganesha consumes /etc/idmapd.conf, which controls
mapping of user/owner identities under NFSv4+.  With containerized service
deployment, this file has beenan immutable part of the container image
and could not be modified.

Recently ceph-ansible was modified to allow the user to set the path
for idmapd.conf and to override ini settings in this file by supplying
json configuration for the overrides in the same way that it can be
supplied for ceph.conf overrides [1].  Also, the default path setting
for the idmapd.conf file is /etc/ganesha/idmap.conf, which already is
reflected into containerized ganesha under /etc/ganesha, solving the
immutability issue.  If no overrides are supplied, the file put in this
location will match that originally frozen into the container, so there
is no issue here with backwards compatibility.

This change exposes parameters for idmap.conf file path and override
contents in TripleO and passes them into ceph-ansible.  It also sets up
these parameters for cephadm.  Cephadm support for OpenStack Ganesha
is WIP so there will likely need to be a followup patch to make these
effective when cephadm replaces ceph ansible.

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/pull/6422

Change-Id: I422e49f0027efbbb25256d8b4718eb0aa78d90a4
(cherry picked from commit 9a42686dc7f9181246fdddf87e35a6a669726cea)

commit_message:
set ganesha idmap.conf file path and overrides

Traditionally,  Ganesha consumes /etc/idmapd.conf, which controls
mapping of user/owner identities under NFSv4+.  With containerized service
deployment, this file has beenan immutable part of the container image
and could not be modified.

Recently ceph-ansible was modified to allow the user to set the path
for idmapd.conf and to override ini settings in this file by supplying
json configuration for the overrides in the same way that it can be
supplied for ceph.conf overrides [1].  Also, the default path setting
for the idmapd.conf file is /etc/ganesha/idmap.conf, which already is
reflected into containerized ganesha under /etc/ganesha, solving the
immutability issue.  If no overrides are supplied, the file put in this
location will match that originally frozen into the container, so there
is no issue here with backwards compatibility.

This change exposes parameters for idmap.conf file path and override
contents in TripleO and passes them into ceph-ansible.  It also sets up
these parameters for cephadm.  Cephadm support for OpenStack Ganesha
is WIP so there will likely need to be a followup patch to make these
effective when cephadm replaces ceph ansible.

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/pull/6422

Change-Id: I422e49f0027efbbb25256d8b4718eb0aa78d90a4
(cherry picked from commit 9a42686dc7f9181246fdddf87e35a6a669726cea)
(cherry picked from commit b2a8641a5c16e43c4d23b4ca372fb0e29f6f6ebc)

commit_message:
Pin charmcraft to 0.10.2

Charmcraft 1.0+ breaks py35 compatibility by introducing f-strings.  As
the charms are still being built on a xenial builder, we currently need
to pin this for the builds.

Close-bug: #1931436
Change-Id: I405d6a36a3299943baeaf7c216bda57eb1ec5f21

commit_message:
Bump molecule to fix testing

We need to bump molecule so that we actually test proposed patches in
CI. Also pull in the podman plugin.

https://github.com/ansible-community/molecule/commit/3d3ce253f396ac0117659bf9f2cbc06c7377b508

Change-Id: I5f15e26332d2b8b1e53539d58fe095997f3151c9
(cherry picked from commit d66f3c80e6593ca9516655970d09d58b1050407e)
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

10:30     strider : mschuppert: Hi Martin, I have a question for you about the compute_tsx validation while dvd is sleeping.
10:31     strider : mschuppert: is this validation downstream only?
10:33  mschuppert : strider hi o/ , no its not only downstream, but 16.2 is the first release we hit this whole tsx mess
10:35     strider : mschuppert: I ask you this because we mention 'rhel' a lot in the validation.
10:36  mschuppert : strider yeah true, but its same for centos

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-11 19:05:38.000000000', 'message': 'Compute TSX validation

RHEL-8.3 kernel disabled the Intel TSX (Transactional
Synchronization Extensions) feature by default as a preemptive
security measure, but it breaks live migration from RHEL-7.9
(or even RHEL-8.1 or RHEL-8.2) to RHEL-8.3.

Operators are expected to explicitly define the TSX flag in
their KernelArgs for the compute role to prevent live-migration
issues during the upgrade process.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1923165
Closes-Bug: #1916758
Change-Id: Icfcfb1c07bbfbe05d27d67187d941c0c34fad2b2

commit_message:
Compute TSX validation

RHEL-8.3 kernel disabled the Intel TSX (Transactional
Synchronization Extensions) feature by default as a preemptive
security measure, but it breaks live migration from RHEL-7.9
(or even RHEL-8.1 or RHEL-8.2) to RHEL-8.3.

Operators are expected to explicitly define the TSX flag in
their KernelArgs for the compute role to prevent live-migration
issues during the upgrade process.

This also impacts upstream CentOS systems.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1923165
Closes-Bug: #1916758
Change-Id: Icfcfb1c07bbfbe05d27d67187d941c0c34fad2b2

commit_message:
functools provide reduce instead of the ansible

The ansible 'reduce' function is itself imported from the functools:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/devel/lib/ansible/module_utils/six/__init__.py#L273

And thus provides exactly the same functionality.
Furthermore, the functools is part of python lib since 2.7,
so the result should be compatible across all of our releases.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I981512fa81f0eb2aac0a50a4709c517cce794fa8

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ia5774787176f67cb45f8dd0536006d37c158f796

commit_message:
Allow customizing podman's [engine]/events_logger

In I780103e17f1bb42a0546c30bd6c001c642ad88b3 we introduced the
journald default for the events_logger key. With this change we
allow to change this new default, in case we do need to change it
for some reason.

Related-Bug: #1923607

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/794633
Change-Id: Ieffe2852111c3ec8347343a042dd78bbf691d79a
(cherry picked from commit 31db48f61d1863a73c04e89d0547848db0661957)

commit_message:
Remove dns server that has sporadic issues

38.102.83.187 is timing out. This server is not needed.
There are two others that are reliable.

Change-Id: I87b1770596ef9dcd01fd94707e94d6b117a06bf4
Closes-Bug: #1931444

commit_message:
Build ganesha idmap.conf file path and apply overrides

As per [1] tripleo-heat-templates now has two parameters that are
supposed to define the location of the idmap.conf file and some
overrides that can be applied via config_template.
This change adds the idmap template and the required tasks to make
it properly rendered in a given location.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/773999

Change-Id: I2b118e6e2184e70d5bccb4ab3cdb7e868ac731e2

commit_message:
Remove iscsi deploy interface from minion node

This is continuation of patch[1] to remove iscsi deploy interface
from minion node. iscsi deploy interface is removed after a year of
deprecation (and a few ML threads)[2]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/749475
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-September/016952.html

Related-Bug: #1931417
Change-Id: Id698a88a83e5218eb6254ae2fe4af6accf0a7306

commit_message:
[STABLE-Only] Change doc requirement file

In order to address the molecule jobs not properly testing modules, we
need to increase molecule to a version that conflicts with
upper-constraints. Since the molecule-requirements.txt was symlinked to
the doc requirements, let's reduce the doc requirements to just be doc
specific.

Change-Id: I6876fd258e0f3216511f544044ca44a68552dd97

commit_message:
Revert "Workaround for jdk zstream breaking freeipa install"

This reverts commit 8ad3c828572d627aa16f4c1c5bb94ccf07caac88.

Reason for revert: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1892216
is merged, we don't have old rpm anymore to pull from mirror.

Related-Bug: #1931228
Change-Id: If1105ba23b338f974b4caf47e1b419a35d23c438

commit_message:
Add support for ovn clustered databases

This patch adds support for managing the ovn connection correctly when
ovn is handling clustering instead of pacemaker. By default if the
parameter is not enabled, the pacemaker managed way is assumed.

Change-Id: I97442478d77d222fdd428eebd270c08df08237f6
Related-Bug: #1931133
